bibl.title: Letter from Hugh L. Scott to William Crawford Gorgas, August 15, 1901

div1.p: Scott directs Gorgas to increase the funding for Carroll's yellow fever research.

div1.head: Letter from Hugh L. Scott to William Crawford Gorgas, August 15, 1901
div1.opener:
C.F. 71
M-H
HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Office of the Adjutant General,
HAVANA
August 15, 1901.
Major W. C. Gorgas,
Chief Sanitary Officer,
City of Havana.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Military Governor directs that you include in
your next regular bi-monthly estimate of funds, under the
heading of “Municipalities-Sanitation”, the sum of $1,000.00,
for experimental work by Dr. James Carroll in the investigation
and study of yellow fever.

You will also include under the same heading a per
diem allowance for Dr. Carroll at the rate of $2.00 per day,
commencing August 11th, 1901, and to continue until further
orders.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, HL Scott Adjutant General.
Aug 15: Copy furnished Dr. Carroll.
1901
C. F.
L. S. 3903
